Tom finds King and is ready to kill him, but King tells him he cured him of his paralysis. He was thrown from a balcony during a prison fight, and the injections were the cure. The steam was a side effect. Tom doesn't believe it and knocks him out. Stephanie makes it there, but Tom would rather kill her instead. Jim makes it just in time and sprays Tom with nitrogen to stop him. It's enough for Stephanie to be freed, but Tom escapes.

Katie confronts Joshua about killing people. She shows him the file and tells him to leave. But he holds on to her and 'convinces' her he never killed people and King never talked to her. And it's all water under the bridge. But at home, Stephanie isn't sure whether to believe Tom or Dr. King. Daphne comes home, and Chris' motorcycle can be heard outside. Jim is livid that Daphne lied to him about going to her friend's house and grounds her for two weeks. Which Daphne 'negotiates' to next time she does it, two weeks. Stephanie asks King about it, and he lies a blue streak about it, not knowing how much Stephanie knew. She asks him about Lena Perkins, and he lies to her again about not knowing where she is. Still, she had to present his award later that night. And while the dinner was going on, Lena and Tom Seeley were taken away, and Dr. King studied the surveillance video to discover the truth about Stephanie and Jim.

description: Dr. King's order for Victoria to infiltrate the Powell home puts all members of its family in grave peril. Meanwhile, JJ gets Daphne's help to investigate a 10-year-unsolved murder.
tags: ['family in jeopardy', 'shapeshifter', 'ex girlfriend', 'cold case', 'unsolved murder', 'shot in the back', 'gun', 'pawnshop', 'street vendor', 'investigation', 'exact double', 'impersonator', 'fistfight', 'dead mother', 'sidewalk cafe', 'mind control']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Stephanie (Julie Benz) walked into the house one night to find it ransacked and Jim (Michael Chiklis) dead on the floor. What happened???

TWELVE HOURS EARLIER

Thanks to her new ability to influence people, Daphne (Kay Panabaker) gets an advance on her allowance. Naturally, JJ (Jimmy Bennett) is jealous, and he wouldn't mind Daphne's help to get back Natalie. Jim and Stephanie talk about Dr. King (Stephen Collins), and Stephanie wants to shadow him to find out what he knows. Jim thinks it's a good idea as a cop. As Stephanie's husband...not so much. Meanwhile, Dr. King had the same idea in finding out how Jim and Stephanie got their abilities. He sends Victoria () the shapeshifter to infiltrate their home. While Stephanie alerts Katie (Autumn Reeser) about what they knew (and she's worried about Stephanie, too, since the hero always gets hurt when they try to talk to the villain), Jim and George (Romany Malco) do some old-fashioned police work in the lair, tracing a phone number Dr. King has called numerous times, the idea being to get the person to flip on King. Jim leaps over to the apartment and hits paydirt. Jeremy Waldren had surveillance photos of the entire family on his wall.

JJ "runs into" Natalie at her regular place for coffee. Before JJ can win her back, Natalie notices a locket a waitress is wearing that looked just like her mother's. That locket was stolen and her mother killed. Natalie gets too worked up and leaves. JJ's research indicated Natalie's mother and a coworker were robbed and shot. The coworker survived. (They did it.) Against Daphne's protestations, JJ is going to investigate and find out what the police couldn't. However, Stephanie being home in the middle of the day caught their attention more. She decided to clean their bathroom, even though she did it the night before. Which is Drama 101 talk for Stephanie not being Stephanie. Victoria takes off before Stephanie arrives at the house. Victoria disguises her voice as Chris and calls Daphne to get her out of the house. She shape-shifts into Daphne to continue her investigations. Although going into Jim and Stephanie's bedroom does raise the alarm bells for JJ, and once again Victoria forgot Daphne was going to help JJ find out about the locket. JJ unknowingly spilled the information about being a superbrain and that Daphne could read minds. Victoria gets out of there before JJ could question her further.

Stephanie's 'in' with Dr. King is to volunteer to continue the trials Dr. Chiles started. Dr. King tries to pass off Chiles' experiments as unethical and illegal, but Stephanie thinks she can make progress and still keep the experiments above board. Dr. King turns her down. Fortunately, Jim calls Stephanie to tell her Dr. King had someone investigating the family. Jim calls Daphne at home, and Victoria got the message. He tells Daphne/Victoria to stay at home with JJ (who wasn't there), and Victoria calls Dr. King right away.

JJ meets up with the real Daphne, who naturally had no knowledge Daphne/Victoria blew him off earlier. Daphne couldn't get the waitress with the locket to give up the information, so she pulls the Jedi mind trick to find out she stole it from an antique shop. And JJ can't help but notice these were not the droids they were looking for. When she gets the antique shop owner to give up the address of the original seller, JJ confronts her about it. ("You just blinked 8 times in the last 2.3 seconds!") She tries it on him to get him to drop it, but it didn't work. JJ claimed he could control 38% more of his brain than the average human. But Daphne is more than free to use her Jedi mind trick on the man who sold the locket.

Back at Waldren's apartment, Jim channeled his inner and lifts some fingerprints using common, everyday household items. However, there was no need, as Victoria walked right in as herself. Jim confronts her and she maces him. By the time he gets to the street, she's disappeared into the crowd, which is easy for her to do, of course. Dr. King is shocked to find out the whole family has powers and that they're permanent. Dr. King tells her to go back in, but Victoria told him Jim could identify her. Dr. King orders her to kill him and take his place. Victoria wonders if that might be because Dr. King has a thing for Stephanie, but he vehemently denies it.

Katie goes home to Joshua/The Watcher (Josh Stewart), who was going through withdrawal symptoms. She tells him to keep getting the injections from King until they could figure out what was going on, but he refused to do it, nor does he want her to tell Stephanie. Will tells her she could replicate King's formula. Stephanie catches her at the lab taking some of the Trilsettum Coronis plant, and Katie can't think of a good lie. Stephanie pretends she's Wonder Woman and has the Lasso of Truth around Katie. Katie spills the beans about Joshua and was keeping it a secret for the same reason Stephanie asked her to keep her family a secret. Katie tells Stephanie Joshua refuses to take the serum, but his body won't allow it. She asks Stephanie for help.

Jim comes home, only to have George shoot him. Jim is ticked George shot him, but obviously Victoria didn't realize Jim was bullet-proof. Somehow, George/Victoria covers his story, as Jim is suddenly the dumbest superhero on the planet. And the real George comes back and denies shooting Jim. ("Maybe it was someone else; you know we'all don't look alike, Jim.") They put all the pieces together and realize the shapeshifter Stephanie ran into a few weeks back was the same woman who maced Jim earlier and pretended to be George, not knowing Jim was bullet-proof. Jim high-tails it to GlobalTech, and Stephanie intercepts him. Or so he thinks. Stephanie/Victoria successfully covers for herself by describing the contents of the nightstand by their bed. And since Jim thought Victoria was Stephanie, he also spilled that he can't kiss anybody wearing Stephanie's cinoxate lip gloss.

JJ and Daphne make it to the house of Kip Rainey, the man who sold the locket. It turns out he was the coworker who was shot with Natalie's mother. He wants to send them on their way, but his wife, Melissa, comes in and offers JJ and Daphne some iced tea. When Daphne touches his wife's fingers as she takes the glass, she sees it was the wife who shot them and took the locket. She runs out to call Jim, but Melissa figures it out and pistol-whips her. She holds JJ at gunpoint, and Kip is panicking because he refuses to help her cover up another murder. Natalie's mother was sleeping with her husband, the the murder was accidental. Right before she's about to shoot JJ, Jim busts down the garage door and takes them out.

Stephanie visits Joshua to tell him she's working on her own serum to counter the effects of the Trilsettum plant. He'd be without powers, but he's fine with that since his organs wouldn't degenerate. Joshua wanted to know why she was doing it, but Stephanie was trying to protect her family, including Katie.

Stephanie comes home as Jim reads JJ and Daphne the riot act about investigating a murder by themselves. She gives him a kiss and...yup, it was Victoria with the cinoxate lip gloss on her. However, the real Stephanie calls him and he figures it out in a hurry. He sends the kids upstairs, telepathing to Daphne they were in danger. Victoria figures it out, too, and lets Jim know she just took away his powers.

JIM: Even without my powers, I'm still fairly confident I can kick your ass.

VICTORIA: (shapeshifts into Jim) Probably. But can you kick yours?

And the battle royale is on. Jim is certain Victoria would never be able to always fool his family into thinking she was him.

JIM: We know a lot more about Dr. King's plans than you think!

VICTORIA: Then you must know Dr. King has his eyes set on your wife. Why else do you think he sent me here to kill you?

Those were the wrong words, and Jim goes the full Vic Mackey on Victoria, nailing her with a poker from the fireplace. And that is the body Stephanie finds when she walks in. Jim walks back down the stairs after checking on the kids, and Victoria conveniently changes back to herself to prove she's dead. Joshua came over to return the favor and got rid of the body. Joshua knew her, and he kept his own identity from the family to keep them protected. But there was a problem: the experiments went way beyond Dr. King, and King would come after the Powells if he found out Victoria was dead. Stephanie decided she could pretend to be Victoria if she knew something only Victoria did. And Jim comes up with an idea the average husband would never think of. He sends Stephanie in to pretend she was Victoria staying in Stephanie's form for the surveillance cameras. And 'Victoria' convinces King to add Stephanie to his team.

description: Thanks to the serum his son Chris stole from the Powell house, Roy Minor goes from being an embittered paraplegic to a raging super-powered ATM machine bandit, so strong not even Jim can stand against him.
tags: ['punching through a door', 'serum', 'fight', 'atm machine', 'child abuse', 'refrigerator', 'boxing lesson', 'rage', 'flashback', 'thrown through a window', 'motorcycle', 'blackmail', 'beer', 'abusive parent', 'theft', 'hospital', 'hypodermic needle', 'engagement party', 'champagne']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Jim (Michael Chiklis) is doing his usual crimefighting. With George's (Romany Malco) help, he traps a crook in an alley, who tries to fire a gun at Jim. Jim does his best Wonder Woman impression to deflect the bullets, only one of those bullets deflects into an apartment complex and hits a kid. Jim follows the boy and his mother to the hospital in a massive feeling of guilt, despite George telling him it can't possibly be his fault.

Joshua (Josh Stewart) is really glad to have met Katie (Autumn Reeser). So much so, he proposes to her...rather badly, but she was 96.3% sure that's what he was doing, and she was 100% sure she wanted to accept. ("I always had a crush on Wolverine, but I never gave much thought to if I married Wolverine. And we had little Wolvie babies.") She told Stephanie (Julie Benz) the good news, who insisted on throwing her an engagement party. ("It's what Batman would do for Robin." "I'm pretty sure Robin's a confirmed bachelor, know what I mean?") At the party, Jim is trying to live down the kid being wounded, but Dr. King (Stephen Collins) decided to drop by the engagement and 'congratulate' the happy couple. Of course, Jim and Stephanie know the truth and were wary of Dr. King pulling something...such as stealing the trilsettum serum Stephanie was working on from their house while there. And using it, too.

Jim and Stephanie let Daphne (Kay Panabaker) and JJ (Jimmy Bennett) in on what happened. Dr. King was an obvious suspect, but he had his own serum, so he wouldn't have motive to steal Stephanie's. Joshua, however, needed it to survive, which he denied when Stephanie confronted him. He asked Katie to trust him, especially since they were engaged. She did. Stephanie, not so much.

As JJ tried to get a date with Natalie, who shoots him down because she has to study to get a scholarship, Jim goes to the hospital to apologize to the kid's mother about him being shot. He doesn't tell her how he was involved, of course, but Stephanie wants him to dig deeper into who stole the serum. Jim's next candidate is Chris, Daphne's boyfriend, since he has a record. Jim is worried about releasing a supervillain on the world, and his fears are confirmed when someone punches out an ATM to get the cash inside of it. A witness saw a blue motorcycle in the area, just like the one Chris rode. Jim confronts Chris on it, except another ATM gets robbed right when Jim is accusing Chris. Daphne was, as you may expect, not happy her dad was accusing her boyfriend of theft. Daphne goes to apologize to Chris about her father, but he has no problem with what he did. Except he hugs her, and she gets the whole story. Chris took the serum to heal his father, who had been in a wheelchair from the auto accident from two years ago Chris felt guilty about. Of course, she couldn't tell him that.

JJ gets an interesting offer from Mr. Litchfield (seriously, is there a sleazier teacher on TV without committing any sort of felony?) to make Natalie's road to the scholarship a lot smoother in exchange for JJ joining the academic decathlon team. He doesn't want to do it, but Litchfield gives her the scholarship to use as leverage against JJ. Now he HAS to join the academic decathlon team in order for her to keep it.

Joshua confronts Dr. King at his office. Dr. King tells him he treated Joshua like his own son, but his son wouldn't have been pumped full of experimental medicines like he was. It cured Joshua but turned him into a killer. Dr. King thought Joshua would come back because he needs his serum to survive unless someone else...and Dr. King correctly figures out Stephanie was helping Joshua. And he accuses Joshua of 'loving' Katie to get Stephanie to help him, which Joshua vehemently denied.

At GlobalTech, the serum Stephanie created to counteract the effects of the trilsettum worked on a lab rat. In fact, the antidote even returned the rat's organs to normal. It was time to see if Joshua wanted to have a go at it. He talks to Katie in private, asking her if she really wants him with no powers. She does, and he takes the injection. After a few -like moments, it doesn't work. Joshua is understandably depressed. Dr. King calls Stephanie into his office to explain about Joshua, and Stephanie plays along about not knowing about Joshua's powers. Except Joshua kept one of those powers a secret from her: the ability to erase memories, which he claims Joshua did to Katie at some point. And suddenly Stephanie remembered that happening to Daphne as well.

Meanwhile, Chris found the money his father, Roy (), stole. It turns out he didn't give a crap about working again and simply wanted yet another beer. Apparently he was a career criminal before the accident. But he can get it himself...by punching a hole in the refrigerator. Obviously he can't control the serum. A fact confirmed by bumping into his son (and knocking him down) on the way out the door to another ATM. Jim comes to see Chris' father, and Chris continues to try to cover for him. But Jim tries to convince him to take his dad into custody. Jim finds him, and the fight is on. Except Roy gets the better of Jim and leaves him in a wall. Jim is concerned about trying to take him down, but he should be more concerned that the serum was wearing off on Roy and he had no problem threatening Daphne and her family to get some more, even throwing his own son out of the house...through the window.

George had an idea to help Jim: keep making Roy miss hitting him, thus expending his energy and serum. He had to put it to good use right away, as Chris finally confessed from his hospital bed Roy was going to GlobalTech to get more of the serum. He takes Katie hostage. She hands him the keys and tries to speed her way to injecting him with a sedative. But like Jim, a needle can't penetrate. Roy grabs the vials and heads for the garage, only to be confronted by Jim. Sure enough, Jim takes George's advice and makes Roy keep punching into concrete. Several misses later, plus some well-timed hits, and Roy is down for the count.

But if Jim was mad at Roy, he was ten times as mad at Joshua for erasing her memory, and he all but puts him into a wall at his house. He tried to explain he was trying to prevent Daphne from turing into him. Katie sees the whole thing, and she hands him back his engagement ring.

Daphne goes to look in on Chris, now that his father was gone. He felt guilty about messing up his father's life two years ago in the accident, but Roy had been messing him up for ages. He didn't feel alone, thanks to Daphne. He didn't say 'I love you' to her directly, but thinking it is enough for Daphne. And it turns out Jasper, the kid who got hit by the bullet Jim deflected, had a small tumor inside of him they never would have caught had he not had surgery for the bullet. Jim feels relief. Katie, as you may have expected, was heartbroken. So was Joshua, who left town, only to discover his powers had finally disappeared.

JJ reluctantly joined the academic decathlon team, and we found out why Litchfield wanted him so badly. He was on the take from Dr. King, who wanted JJ to solve a particular math problem.

description: A super pheromone seductress ensnares men's minds seeking the best one to handle a special project, putting George and Jim at risk. Meanwhile, Daphne deflects Chris's questions about her family.
tags: ['pheromones', 'mind control', 'soldier', 'memory loss', 'mind alteration', 'time bomb', 'claws', 'hypodermic needle', 'injection', 'murderer', 'villainess', 'boyfriend girlfriend relationship', 'kiss', 'car bomb', 'reference to charlie sheen', 'bomb', 'armed robbery', 'gun', 'cough syrup', 'pharmacy']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Dr. King (Stephen Collins) still has his doubts about Stephanie (Julie Benz), so his assistants bring him the perfect warm-up case to give her: a prisoner, Lucas Winnick (), with Stage 4 Lymphoma. He asks Stephanie to inject him with the trilsettum plant, but Stephanie's worried about the side effects. But King gives her little choice, much like Katie (Autumn Reeser) not giving the family much choice in helping her deal with her post-Joshua depression. Which means Charades...AND Scattergories. Thankfully, George (Romany Malco) has a way for Jim (Michael Chiklis) to get out of it. It seemed like a simple case: apprehend someone stealing cough syrup from a pharmacy. One Jim Powell brakes special later, done. However, a woman comes to visit George at the police station. A statuesque blonde named Sophie Adler () 'asks' George if it was really necessary to prosecute the man. And an odd mist passes from her to George. Suddenly the case is dropped, much to Jim's surprise, and George has a date with Sophie. It turns out, the man stealing the cough syrup was doing it for her, possibly to use the active ingredients in it for crystal meth. It would make sense, since it didn't make sense to Jim why a soccer dad of three was stealing cough syrup. George wants to go out to dinner, but Sophie wants him to do her a favor first. One mist spray later, and George is robbing a pharmacy at gunpoint. Completely denying it to Jim, as you may imagine, since he had no recollection of any of it. This in spite of the fact the description of the robber included the same brown suit and chartreuse tie George wore on his date with Sophie.

Daphne (Kay Panabaker) and Chris are in school, where Chris was about to receive a week of after-school detention for being late three times to class. However, one Jedi mind trick later, and he gets his third warning instead. Chris was already suspicious of the Powells, since his father called him from jail claiming he saw Jim with superhuman strength and Stephanie with superhuman speed. Daphne tried to play it off. But Chris saw her talk the robber from shooting them, and Chris was trying to put the pieces together. Of course, Daphne can pull the Jedi mind trick on him, too. JJ's (Jimmy Bennett) term for it was 'pushing', and she pushed her boyfriend. ("He used to have two thoughts on his mind, and now he only has one?") But JJ asked a good question: how long she could make it last? JJ thinks her push only stopped him from asking questions, not being suspicious or putting the same details about the family back together again. Daphne might have to give him more pushes. Sure enough, Chris brings it up again later, and she gets him out of it...for about three seconds. And it isn't getting better.

As Jim and Stephanie prepare for their double-date with George and Sophie, Stephanie tells him about having to inject a prisoner. Even though Lucas' major crime was check kiting, Jim is still worried about injecting a criminal with superpowers. Stephanie agrees, but it was the only way to get in with Dr. King and figure out who he is working for. George was already throwing around the "L" word regarding Sophie, even though they only met a day ago. And George clearly left his testicles at home, since he was wishing Sophie a Happy Day-iversary.) Sophie actually went along with that, as long as they had the lobster with white wine. She insisted on those, in fact. George was happy to partake, even though he was highly allergic to shellfish. Jim pulls him aside to ask him what was wrong, but George kept denying everything, even accusing Jim of being jealous. Jim tells him he threw the sketch out to cover for him, and George ends the dinner right then and there. Sophie asks him about it, and George thinks Jim is just overstepping his bounds as a sketch artist. Sophie goes back to apologize to Jim and Stephanie. She gives Jim a kiss, and you can guess Jim gets influenced.

Later that night, Stephanie agrees with Jim's original assessment of George 'showing off' for Sophie, but now Jim no longer agrees with that. Now he thinks Sophie is great. In fact...

JIM: Sophie's the most beautiful woman I've ever seen in my life.

That went over with Stephanie as well as you might imagine. And Jim dropping off a dozen roses at Sophie's apartment is a lot worse, particularly since George was having that exact same idea at that exact same moment. As if that wasn't awkward enough, Jim tells George he's in love with Sophie. George is ticked and the two are about to step off. Only Jim's definition of step off sends George flying through the air and into a wall with just a tiny push. Sophie is shocked, but Jim is more than happy to boast of his skills. One little mist later, and Sophie's traded up, sending Jim to get four heating elements the Army uses to heat MREs. This, of course, would require Jim to breach an army base, take out a few soldiers, and steal the MRE heating elements. Back at home, Stephanie wonders where Jim had been all day, since she couldn't contact him. Sophie calls and tells him to bring the boxes over. Jim makes an excuse to leave but is dumb enough to pass by Daphne, who knows where he's really going. And she tells Stephanie where Jim is really going.

At the lab, King makes one of the most awkward passes at a woman in history (seriously, even I've done better), and they go to meet Lucas. Lucas wants to know if the trilsettum therapy will fix him. Stephanie hesitates but tells him it will.

Jim delivers the boxes, and Sophie promises more work for him with his skills. But she decides to make out with him as a thank you. And yes, Stephanie sees it. Thankfully, she confronts him about it right away, but Jim is completely off the reservation, more than happy to throw away 18 years of marriage for Sophie. Stephanie tosses him out, and Jim is only happy to go. Sophie witnesses the entire exchange from a distance before meeting up with a woman who demands an update on the project. Mrs. X () was upset Dr. King was letting too many 'supers' run around loose in the city. Sophie promised the woman she found the perfect candidate to carry out the project, and the woman tells her in no uncertain terms it better work.

Then things got weird. Jim went to crash at George's place as if he didn't steal Sophie from him and throw him into a wall. Even weirder, George doesn't remember being with Sophie or being thrown into a wall. (Interesting...) And now George wondered what the hell Jim was doing walking out on Stephanie, but Jim didn't really care.

Without Sophie's 'influence', George suddenly had a theory about what was going on and went to JJ to talk to him about it. JJ was up in arms over Jim leaving the family, but George didn't even recall meeting Sophie yet somehow introduced her to Jim. And since JJ knew George was gaga over Sophie, he correctly concluded it was some sort of specialized pheromones Sophie was using. JJ guessed Sophie chemically enhanced the pheromones she naturally gave off, but why was the question. George and JJ go to Sophie's apartment and hit the mother of all meth labs. But JJ has a look at the chemicals. The bad news: the chemicals weren't for pheromone enhancement, meaning his dad is a nutjob. The Worse news: the chemicals were for a bomb big enough to take down an entire building. But George asks the big question: what does the blonde bombshell bomb maker need with Jim? The answer: Jim is to deliver a backpack to 'an old friend', or specifically between the propane tanks on the roof of the building where her old friend works. The old friend is Dr. King, and the building is GlobalTech.

At GlobalTech, Stephanie injects Lucas, although not without serious reservations...not to mention a serious reaction by Lucas. As she goes out for air, George calls her and tells her everything. She's not happy JJ got involved, but they correctly guessed Sophie had to be a super. ("It would explain why Jim's acting like Charlie Sheen." Gotta love the irony of the Sheen 20/20 interview the same night, huh?) Stephanie was at least partially-relieved Jim wasn't acting of his own accord, but obviously Jim delivering a bomb somewhere kind of dampened the mood. And George triangulating Jim's mobile phone to GlobalTech really makes it interesting.

Stephanie caught up to Jim and tried to stop him. However, Sophie was right there to 'influence' him into staying with her. Stephanie knew it was the pheromones Sophie was giving off that was controlling him.

STEPHANIE: And to think the other night I just thought you were wearing really cheap perfume.

SOPHIE: Men seem to like it, don't they?

Sophie doesn't think Stephanie can stop Jim, but Stephanie is more confident in her truly being in love with Jim. She tells Jim Sophie wants him to blow up the building, but Jim continues to go through with it. She begs him not to do it and tells him about all of the things they built together: the house, the birth of the kids. Jim says he feels passion with Sophie, but Stephanie shows him what passion is by laying quite the kiss on him. Yes, it worked. This is television, after all. Of course, they only have 15 seconds to defuse the bomb, but Jim tosses it like a frisbee. Yes, it explodes into fireworks as they kiss.

Sophie, having failed, met with Mrs. X again, who wonders what happened. She leaves Sophie, who breathes a sigh of relief and goes back to her car...and blows up.

Chris confronts Daphne once again about her family's superpowers, but this time Daphne can't make him forget again. She tells the truth. He wonders what she could do, and she tells him she could read and influence thoughts. Daphne understood if Chris wanted to dump her for that, but Chris is glad someone shared such an important secret with him for the first time in his life, and he had no intention of leaving. Quite the opposite, actually.

Stephanie returned to the lab to find Winnick gone, and she had been lied to. Winnick was a murderer. And Dr. King had a job for him, especially given Lucas's ability to grow claws ("That's a new one."). What that job would be was a mystery, but Mrs. X had a job for him already. She picks him up in her limo.

description: No one with superpowers is safe when a predatory, werewolf-like super begins hunting them all down, including the Powells - and, surprisingly, Katie, too.
tags: ['music video', 'scarred face', 'scars', 'claws', 'scream', 'skipping school', 'pregnancy', 'sociopath', 'life threatening illness', 'fistfight', 'blood', 'coroner', 'dead woman', 'running']
synopsis_with_character_names:
A jogger goes through a wooded area, only to be attacked and killed by what appears to be some sort of animal like a mountain lion. The only trouble is, mountain lions have four claws, not five. They would also leave tracks, which this murderer didn't. Jim (Michael Chiklis) suspects a super might have attacked the woman and asks George (Romany Malco) to talk to the coroner's office about it. But of course Lucas Winnick () was the man behind it, and Mrs. X () tasks him with recovering the body, which he does. He also takes out the coroner who discovered something unusual about the woman but was unable to tell Jim and George about it. Jim and Stephanie (Julie Benz) are understandably worried this person might be attacking other supers, since the woman and a third victim had trace elements of the same chemicals in their bodies the Powells had from the trilsettum plant. Sure enough, Stephanie slips in during the investigation at the crime scene of the third victim and finds the trilsettum serum.

Daphne (Kay Panabaker) and Chris are still together, except Chris wants her to ditch school to go to a Sarah Bareilles concert at a shopping mall. (Didn't that stuff go out with the 80s?) Anyway, Daphne doesn't want to ditch, but ironically, Chris is pretty good at influencing her. She strikes a deal with JJ (Jimmy Bennett) to finish the history paper she was going to complete in math class in exchange for her finding out why Mr. Litchfield continues to give him weird and incredibly difficult equations to solve under the guise of the academic decathlon. A little Jedi mind trick on the vice-principal in the hall who caught them, and they even have their lunch and gas paid for.

Lucas tracks down Katie (Autumn Reeser), of all people, presumably looking for Joshua. Scaring the crap out of Katie in the process, he thinks Joshua is still around, even though Katie assured him they broke up and hasn't talked to him since. However, Lucas gets a scent of something (think a Wolverine/Beast combination...without the personality). He goes animal on Katie. She screams...and propels Lucas across the street to land on a car and crush it. WTF???

Katie, completely freaked out by what happened, called Jim and Stephanie over, but it didn't take long for her to figure out she was the one to telekinetically launch that 'manimal' into her neighbor's car. She's more freaked out and needs to sit down...and a chair pulls right up to her. Now everybody is freaked out. Stephanie wants to take Katie for some tests, but Jim thinks bigger picture, since this person was hunting supers, such as their kids. Unfortunately, Lucas was already calling Mrs. X to confirm both Katie and the Powells weren't on the trilsettum vaccines but he was picking up a scent from them anyway. Mrs. X tells him to kill all of them.

At school, JJ is refusing to do the equation Litchfield gave him, and Litchfield calls Dr. King (Stephen Collins) for help. Dr. King, who blew off Stephanie's theories earlier in the day about one of the test subjects being on the loose, tells Litchfield it's his problem. ("You have three degrees and you're teaching high school. Since when has knowledge helped you achieve anything?") He tells Litchfield to get on it or he'd have to intervene. Mr. Litchfield tries to intervene in the only way a very bad teacher would: with threats. Fortunately, Stephanie arrived to get him out of school and they went to find Daphne, who was currently convincing the bodyguard at the Sara Bareilles concert they were on the list.

Katie tried to describe the man who attacked her to sketch artist Jim, but he needed a English-Nerd translation book. (GEORGE: How did someone as fine as you become such a geek?) (WE ALL WANT TO KNOW THAT!!!) Fortunately, modern technology gave them Lucas' profile, except he was on death row according to the computer. However, Stephanie arrives and admits she might have actually 'created' Lucas. Stephanie goes to the house, only Lucas is already there. He admits he was hired to kill them. Stephanie thinks George can get him a lighter sentence if he turns evidence. But he didn't buy it...and put his claws through Stephanie.

Jim gets back to find Stephanie still gone and bolts for the house. Fortunately, Stephanie's fast metabolism kept her from dying. ("He found me...and I think I stained the floor.") Jim takes her to George's lair at her insistence. He wants to find Daphne, and he orders JJ to hack into her cell phone and email to figure out where she is. He finds the text from Chris, and Jim heads over to Windward Hall to find her. Unfortunately, Lucas is already there. Jim calls her and she tries to get away from the concert to call him back. Lucas finds her and pretends to work at the school, telling Daphne her mother had been attacked. For some reason, she can't read his mind and agrees to go along. Fortunately, Jim gets there just in the nick of time (yes, they do that on this show). However, Lucas can take a punch and can leap through the air like Jim can. Jim finally gets the upper hand and was almost ready to kill him before Daphne begged him to stop. After all, his powers would eventually wear off.

Back at home, Stephanie was getting worse from some kind of infection in her. She still refused to go to the hospital, but JJ was able to diagnose the bacteria that got in Stephanie's system. Jim had one doctor he could take Stephanie to, even though it sounded crazy: Dr. King. King tried to play innocent, but Jim told him they had to put aside what they knew about each other to save Stephanie's life. Dr. King confirmed Lucas gave her the infection, and Jim told King to give her the trilsettum serum, regardless of the side effects it may cause. Jim gives her the shot, and Jim tells her to rest, even though she's wondering why she was at GlobalTech. She then goes out for a run...and disappears.

Daphne drops off JJ's equation to Mr. Litchfield, but all she could get out of him was Litchfield being relieved he wouldn't go back empty handed. Given everything that had happened, Daphne wants to stop dating Chris for a while, but he has a whole list of fun for them to try. Dr. King is happy with the email he got from Litchfield, but not so happy to see Mrs. X at the door. She wants to know why there are supers running free throughout the city. She was to take full control of the research from now on. On the good side (for Dr. King, anyway), he was one equation closer (thanks to JJ) to making the serum's effects permanent. Of course, he could do what Katie did: get impregnated by a super.

description: The Trilsettum injection that saved Stephanie's life grants her the power of time travel, revealing to her a grievous future of full-out persecution for her family and stiff prison sentences for loyal friends.
tags: ['running', 'gun', 'time travel', 'mind alteration', 'memory loss', 'mind control', 'altering the future', 'seeing the future', 'assassination attempt', 'leather jacket', 'return from dead', 'loyalty', 'boyfriend girlfriend relationship', 'violation of rights', 'corrupt cop', 'silencer', 'drive by shooting']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Stephanie (Julie Benz) went out for her run. Sure enough, she ran into the future. Two days ahead, to be exact. She comes upon her house to find it surrounded by the military. (Think ). She goes into the house, only Jim (Michael Chiklis), Daphne (Kay Panabaker), and JJ (Jimmy Bennett) can't see or hear her. Jim is going to send the kids out the back and create a distraction so they can escape. Suddenly, she gets pulled back to the present, where Jim wonders if everything is OK, only Stephanie isn't even sure what just happened. But she insisted Jim go to Cordero's farewell party, as he was being assigned to a new district. Cordero was sorry to not see Jim anymore, but tragically there would be no transfer as Cordero is gunned down in the street by what looked like a gang. An investigation begins, but Mrs. Cordero talks to Jim and George (Romany Malco) privately, saying Cordero was worried about a particular case in the court system, which might have had something to do with his murder.

Stephanie finds out from Daphne and JJ Mr. Litchfield was giving him complex equations to solve and was worried about JJ not finishing them. Stephanie runs out to the school to talk to Mr. Litchfield, only she ran into the future again, where the school is surrounded by the military, JJ and Daphne are hiding out, and George has to hold back the authorities from capturing them. Stephanie gets pulled back to the present but correctly figures out the government now knew they were supers, and they guess Daphne's boyfriend, Chris, must have ratted them out, since Daphne stopped doing favors for him with her Jedi mind tricks. A third run into the future, and Stephanie sees an FBI agent rough up Katie (Autumn Reeser) when she refuses to talk, injuring (perhaps even killing) her unborn child in the process. Then she sees all of them at the police station, and she was being grilled by the same FBI agent while Jim, Daphne, and JJ were sedated. But she does hear about an incident on the news in City Square that prompted the events. She has to figure out a way to time travel forward to that exact location and time. It's a lot of difficult math, but JJ is kind of a specialist in that.

Mrs. X () used the trilsettum to bring Victoria the shape-shifter back to life, apparently brought to her by Joshua. (Really? You could drive a truck through that plot hole.) Anyway, her job is to find out more about Katie's pregnancy (not sure how she found out about that, either). She takes out Katie's OB/GYN and is about to give the baby a check of the amniotic fluid, but Katie thinks it's a bit too early for that.

Jim gets a call from Mrs. Cordero when she comes home to find her house ransacked. Whoever did it was looking for something but didn't find it. However, she had a fairly educated guess it was in a safe she didn't even know about until recently. Jim picked the lock in that way he has and discovered personnel files on a group of cops. George suspected Cordero had a list of dirty cops, and it was a gang that shot Cordero in order to keep being protected by those dirty cops. It was confirmed when O'Bannon, one of the investigators, pulls Jim aside to allay suspicions about his partner, Rizzo, being a dirty cop, too. Jim meets him in private in a parking garage. And if this sounded like a setup, then you were right. The same gang guns down Jim in the garage. Of course, he only comes away with some scratches and a lot of anger.

JJ crunches the numbers and helps Stephanie get safely to City Square two minutes before whatever happened to bring the government down on the Powells. What Stephanie didn't expect is Daphne being involved. She got a text from Chris to be at the square as soon as he finished his last tow. Jim was also there, looking around for potential suspects. Unfortunately, he found it. Someone was about to shoot George as he gave his memorial speech to Detective Cordero. He rams the SUV the assassin was in, flips it through the air...and a cameraman catches all of it. She gets dragged back to the present, and to stop their family from being found out, she has to stop Jim from saving George's life.

Jim comes home and Stephanie explains everything. But Jim can't reach George and he can't call the police since it's a dirty cop who is doing the shooting. Stephanie all but begs him not to use his powers, but Jim can't let George be killed, either. At the City Square, Chris apologizes to Daphne for being mad at her about not using her powers to help him. Jim continues to look through the crowd. He manages to find the same rifle sticking out of the same SUV, only he manages to avoid the cameraman and punch out the assassin inside, who turns out to be Rizzo. Both men are in on it, and now Jim has to find O'Bannon. O'Bannon makes his way through the crowd. But Jim knew Daphne was there, so he calls her on his cell to ask her to listen to everybody's mind at the memorial to locate O'Bannon. Daphne slips through the crowd of uniformed officers looking for O'Bannon. She spots him and calls Jim, but Jim can't get there fast enough without showing off his leaping ability. Over Jim's protests, Daphne comes up behind O'Bannon and pulls the Jedi mind trick on him. It works, and Daphne gets his gun. But Jim and Stephanie are mad as hell at her. (Gee, there's gratitude for you.) But Daphne hadn't told them about her Jedi mind trick. (JJ: Just FYI, she hasn't done dishes in two weeks.) Stephanie thinks Daphne can go to Chris and make him forget about the Powells' abilities like Joshua did with her, but Daphne is strongly opposed to doing that. There was just one little problem with making Chris forget: she'd have to break up with him. Given that she was in love with him and he forgot about that, too, it was certainly understandable.

Mr. Litchfield also disappeared, and Victoria gave the amniotic test results to Mrs. X. Katie's child had the trilsettum fully integrated into its DNA. Since Victoria used to have a thing for Joshua, she didn't seem too upset with getting to raise Katie's child, since Mrs. X planned to kill Katie as soon as she delievered it.

description: With her patience at an end and a plane-load of convicts awaiting transformation, Mrs. X orders the kidnapping of JJ in order to wrest from him the secret on how to make super powers permanent.
tags: ['convict', 'prisoner', 'kidnapping', 'series finale', 'maniac villain', 'government agent', 'unrequited love', 'crash dive', 'airplane', 'stillborn baby', 'needle in eye', 'shot in the chest', 'impostor', 'incarceration', 'elevator', 'doctor', 'shapeshifter', 'arcade game', 'cancer', 'electric shock', 'blackout', 'electrocution', 'death', 'teacher']
synopsis_with_character_names:
George (Romany Malco) is on a small plane that is about to crash. Sound familiar? It's how everything started for the Powells back in September. Back at home, Mr. Litchfield has denigrated into stalker, chasing after JJ (Jimmy Bennett) to solve the equations he assigned him. JJ refuses, and Litchfield contacts Dr. King (Stephen Collins) about it. Dr. King, a bit under the weather, has no sympathy for Litchfield. Nor does Mrs. X (, who is actually the CEO of GlobalTech. She decides to handle it her own way. As does Jim (Michael Chiklis), when JJ tells him about Mr. Litchfield. But Mrs. X got there first: Mr. Litchfield was dead.

George is keeping an eye on Katie (Autumn Reeser), who apparently is not far off from giving birth. Probaby around six months pregnant, but George assures her she won't go through it alone. True, since Joshua (Josh Stewart) shows up to talk to her after George goes off to talk to Jim. It turns out Mr. Litchfield was electrocuted, according to George's friend in the Coroner's Office. Jim thinks a super may have done it. He calls home to Stephanie (Julie Benz), who assures him JJ and Daphne (Kay Panabaker) are OK, although they were having power problems. JJ goes to investigate the circuit box, only to be zapped by the same guy who killed Litchfield.

Jim and Stephanie go right to their first suspect, Dr. King. As it turns out, he is a victim as well. It turns out the trilsettum serum was keeping King alive, as he had cancer for 18 years, which should have killed him long before now. Mrs. X, better known as Helen Burton, CEO of GlobalTech. She was looking for the formula to make the superpowers permanent and was holding JJ in a cell at GlobalTech until he gave her the answers. But he has a cellmate: Joshua, who explains Stephanie's antidote cured him and lets him live without any powers. Of course, if Joshua is there, then the Joshua with Katie must be Victoria, the shape-shifter. But Joshua provided a very important piece of the puzzle. The plane Stephanie and her family went on to Brazil was loaded down with the trilsettum plant because Global Tech was using it to smuggle the plant into the United States. When the plane caught on fire, the family inhaled a significant amount of it, unlike all the other supers, who had it injected.

Jim, Stephanie, and Daphne slip into GlobalTech to find JJ. Daphne is very adept at stopping one guard from shooting them or reporting them to the authorities. Jim could stop any bullet fired at them, but not if they were surrounded. That's where Stephanie's super-speed comes in handy to disarm a cadre of armed soldiers. But it turned out to be all for nothing. Burton was watching them the whole time and manages to gas them on an elevator.

George goes to get medications from Katie's OB/GYN, only the man had no recollection of ever seeing Katie. Which would make sense, given Victoria knocked him out with a tire iron. George puts two and two together and warns Katie Joshua/Victoria isn't who he says he is. Joshua put the same two and two together when JJ told him about Katie's baby. But it was too late. Burton brought Stephanie and a drugged Katie into a room and put guns to their heads while Jim was wacked up with cinoxate to remove his powers. JJ gave her the information, including the final piece: the Powells had actual adrenaline going through them when they inhaled the trilsettum instead of the epinephrine they mixed into the injections. Of course, Burton ordered all of them killed, anyway. And three shots were fired...by Dr. King, at the guards. He also finds Joshua, his son, and tells him to go protect Katie and their child.

King sends Stephanie to get the chopper with Burton in it, since she had 80 criminals at the ready to dose with the trilsettum and sell to the highest bidder. King went to get Jim. Except King still had a thing for Stephanie and decided to get rid of her husband by shooting him. King goes to tell her a guard shot Jim before he got there. One little problem: the cinoxate wore off before the bullets could do any permanent damage. Jim puts Dr. King into a wall...only Dr. King has a big dose of the trilsettum going through him, allowing him to have all of the Powells' abilities. He sets forth to break Jim's neck, and Daphne can't 'convince' him otherwise. But Stephanie can get a syringe of the antidote she created. She tries to trick Dr. King into letting her get close, but he gets the upper hand. He's ready to kill her, but JJ picks up the syringe and does some quick math to throw it like a dart into King's eye. (gross!) Sure enough, Dr. King is trilsettum-free, and the cancer he had ravages him in mere seconds.

Joshua breaks into Katie's house to reveal Victoria, although Katie did the ol shape-shifter fake-out by pretending to know things about her and Joshua that Victoria gets wrong. victoria runs when Joshua tells her he was never in love with her, but in the struggle, Katie's water breaks. They have no choice but to have the baby there, and it doesn's survive. Well, if it was a normal baby. But this kid is part super, so 14 weeks premature is no big deal for it.

The Powells, after all that had happened, finally get to settle down. Except the NSA comes calling and tells them about the plane crash that took place in Northern California with 81 people on board. Except they couldn't find a single body. The NSA knew about the Powells' abilities and wanted them to round up the 80 criminals on board, all of whom had permanent superhuman abilities. The 81st? George, who snuck on the flight.

description: When Granddad and Ed Wuncler open a soul-food restaurant, it ends up having a terrible effect on Woodcrest.
tags: ['stabbed with a fork', 'reference to krispy kreme', 'krispy kreme doughnut', 'reference to biz markie', 'huey freeman character', 'riley freeman character', 'robert freeman character', 'ed wuncler character', 'uncle ruckus charater', 'tom dubois character', 'sarah dubois character', 'jazmine dubois character', 'hand drawn animation']
synopsis_with_character_names:
This episode is a metaphor about a white banker funding a black drug dealer in an effort to profit off the drug sales up front and then profit even more in the longer term by buying up the blighted real estate in the area affected by the negative consequences of that drug use.

Grandpa's Greasy Soul Food stands in as a substitute for narcotics strong enough to induce a stupor "the itis" when consumed and feelings of withdrawal identical to those experienced by hardcore street addicts in need of a fix. Wunsler's sudden interest in funding Grandpa's "lifelong" dream (scripted joke-three weeks since seeing a TV cooking show) is fully exposed in the fade to end scene when he smiles at the sight of the urban blight he knew he would create by funding Grandpa's dispersion of the Soul Food (drugs). Huey plays the usual part of morally outraged kid while his greedy brother smiles broadly at the spoils. The full genius of Wunsler's premeditated evil is saved for the final reveal where (IIRC) a voice-over fills in the details of his genius success in the fine art of forced real estate acquisition at bargain basement prices while panning the rundown wreckage of a formerly vibrant community.
