description: Fourteen years after retiring from Starfleet, Jean-Luc Picard, still haunted by the death of Data, is living a quiet life on his family vineyard when a woman comes to him for help.
tags: ['star trek', 'reference to data', 'reference to star trek the next generation', 'starfleet', 'romulan', 'season premiere', 'poker', 'begins with a dream', 'france', 'vineyard', 'boston massachusetts', 'throwing knife', 'stabbed in the chest', 'stabbed to death', 'bag over head', 'series premiere', 'spontaneous combustion', 'android', 'explosion', 'necklace', 'same actress playing twin role', 'death of boyfriend', 'faking a tell', 'one on one poker game', 'all in bet', 'waking up from a nightmare', 'pet dog', 'chateau picard', 'futuristic boston night cityscape', 'orchid', 'throwing a knife', 'romulan assassin', 'daystrom institute', 'interview', 'rescue mission', 'earl grey tea', 'painting', 'archive', 'hologram', 'supernova', 'okinawa', 'human android war', 'fractal neuronic coding', 'utopia planitia fleet yard', '24th century', 'friend', 'friendship', 'united federation of planets', 'alien', 'jean luc picard character']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Picard enjoys a game of poker with Data on a star ship. Picard amuses himself that Data pretends to have a tell, but his real tell is that he doesn't have one. Picard admits he is lonely. Turns out Picard was dreaming, and he wakes up in his bed at home. His dog is named "Number One". His runs his own vineyard in France. Picard is looked after by Jaris (Orla Brady) and Zhaban (Jamie McShane), who are both Romulans.

In an interview, retired Starfleet Admiral Jean-Luc Picard (Patrick Stewart) reveals that he resigned in protest after Starfleet abandoned plans to rescue Romulan citizens from a supernova when rogue synthetics attacked the rescue fleet. Romulans had asked for Federation help and Picard believed that it was their profound obligation to give it. Federation chose to support the rescue effort initially and Picard left the Enterprise to lead the rescue armada of 10,000 warp capable ferries to relocate 900 million Romulan citizens.

A group of rogue synthetics dropped the planetary defense shields around Mars and hacked Mars' own defense net, wiping out the rescue armada stationed there. The Utopia Planitia shipyard was destroyed, and the explosions ignited the flammable vapors in Martian stratosphere. Mars is on fire till this day. 92,143 lives were lost. Starfleet banned the creation of synthetics after the attack. It is still not clear why synthetics went rouge and did what they did. Data was a synthetic, but Picard never lost faith in him. Picard resigned as it was no longer Starfleet. The Galaxy was mourning and Starfleet slunk from its duties. It was criminal to abandon the Romulans to their fate.

Romulan assassins attack a young woman named Dahj (Isa Briones) and kill her partner. She was just selected as a fellow to the Daystrom institute on Artificial Intelligence and Quantum Consciousness. This triggers something in Dahj, and she is able to kill the assassins.

Experiencing visions of Picard and seeing his interview, Dahj seeks him out. Picard does not recognize Dahj. Dahj recounts the attack on her, but doesn't know who attacked her. Jaris treats Dahj's wounds. Dahj says that she feels safe with Picard. The next morning, Dahj leaves without informing Picard. After meeting her, Picard visits Starfleet Archives and finds a painting that features a figure who resembles Dahj. Entitled "Daughter", the painting was given to Picard by his android former lieutenant commander Data (Brent Spiner). It was one from a set of two similar paintings that Data created.

Dahj calls her mother (Sumalee Montano) who tells her to go back to Picard. Dahj quickly hacks into various programs to find Picard in real time. Picard tells Dahj how Data was his friend, and sacrificed his life for Picard over 2 decades ago. Picard tells Dahj that Data painted her as she is now, but more than 30 years ago. He named the painting "daughter". Picard says that Dahj is a synthetic and that the attack on her, "activated" her.

More Romulan assassins attack Picard and Dahj, and Dahj is killed. Laris brings Picard back home. She says that Picard was alone when he was found, and the security feed also didn't have anyone with Picard. Picard meets with Dr. Agnes Jurati (Alison Pill) at the Daystrom Institute, who explains that Dahj could be Data's daughter due to an experimental procedure known as fractal Neuronic cloning, which results in twin androids with organic bodies. After Data's death, Bruce Maddox (John Ales) continued the work on creating a sentient Synthetic. But due to the Mars incident, the Synthetic were banned and Maddox could never complete his work. It is still not possible to create a sentient synthetic without a copy of Data's Positronic neural net. Fractal Neuronic cloning was Maddox's idea. A copy of the entire neural net could be possible with a single Neuron. Maddox somehow achieved fractal Neuronic cloning and fashion the organic bodies using Data's old painting.

Meanwhile, Dahj's twin, Soji Asha (Isa Briones), is working in a Borg Cube that has been reclaimed by Romulan refugees. Soji meets Narek (Harry Treadaway), who says he had a brother whom he lost a year earlier.

description: Without the support of Starfleet, Picard turns to Dr. Agnes Jurati and his estranged colleague Raffi Musiker for help in finding the truth about Dahj, unaware that hidden enemies are also interested in what he'll find.
tags: ['star trek', 'reference to star trek first contact', 'cbs all access', 'reference to data', 'year 2385', 'mars', 'reference to isaac asimov', 'brother sister relationship', 'hologram', 'woman wears overalls', 'woman wears a uniform', 'woman wears gloves', 'woman shot', 'woman killed', 'android suicide', 'android murders human', 'space attack', 'tal shiar', 'zhat vash', 'earl grey tea', 'jean luc picard character', 'united federation of planets', 'future', 'retired captain', 'sequel', 'friend', 'retired hero', 'future technologies', 'starship crew', 'retired space captain', 'century24', 'friendship', '24th century', 'alien', 'old friendship', 'old friends', 'returning from retirement', 'captain return from retirement']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Utopia Planitia Shipyards on Mars were attacked in 2385, 14 years ago. The synthetics were deeply involved in running the mundane operations on the shipyard. F8 was one such synthetic. All of a sudden, something changes and the F8 brings down planetary defense shields on Mars. F8 kills all of its human supervisors. Satellites and autonomous spaceships in orbit around Mars start their attack. As the stratosphere ignites, F8 proceeds to kill itself.

Hoping to find Soji before the assassins get to her, Picard investigates Dahj's apartment with his Romulan employee Laris. The latter believes the assassins may be members of the Zhat Vash, a secretive organization with a deep-rooted hatred of synthetics. Zhat Vash are the keepers of secrets. Rumors suggest that the Zhat Vash are keeping a secret so terrible that even learning it could break a person's mind. Their reason for the loathing of any form of synthetic life, is the secret. Laris helps Picard discover Soji's location from Dahj's computer. Liras ascertains that Soji's messages to Dahj came from off world subspace relays. Soji is not on Earth.

On the Borg Cube, called the "Artifact", Soji develops a relationship with Romulan agent Narek while she works on a project to remove Borg technology from former Borg drones. Soji thinks that the Romulans are profiting from the sale of Borg Technology on the black market. The Artifact is severed from the collective. It is broken and lost. Narek is very secretive with Soji and doesn't reveal anything about himself.

Despite the onset of a terminal illness, Picard asks Starfleet Admiral Kirsten Clancy for a ship and crew to find Soji. Picard says that Maddox is using neurons from Data to create a new line of organic synthetics. Romulans are involved as well. And if some part of Data exists, Picard wants to retrieve it before it is lost. She refuses him and says that everyone saw Picard's interview where he blamed Starfleet. Romulans were the enemies and Starfleet tried to help them as long as they could. Even before the synthetics attacked, 14 allies had asked the Federation to cut the Romulans loose or loose the Federation. The Federation didn't have enough ships left and had to make choices, but Captain Picard did not like his orders. Picard warns of an oncoming calamity, but Kirsten says Picard is delusional and is desperate to matter again.

Kirsten refers the incident to Starfleet's security chief Commodore Oh (Tamlyn Tomita), who discusses it with a lieutenant; this is Narek's sister Narissa (Peyton List) in disguise. Commodore Oh is also Romulan. Kirsten tells Oh that Picard suspected clandestine Romulan synthetic operations on Earth. Narissa led the assassins to kill Dahj while Narek is approaching his target, Soji, with seduction rather than violence. Oh chastises Narissa for her mistakes that led to Picard's meeting with Kirsten. Oh tells Narissa not to focus on Picard and stay on mission. Mission was to capture Dahj alive for interrogation and then only have one more chance. Narissa almost blew their cover. Oh wants Narissa to make sure that she and Narek capture Soji. Narrisa and Narek want to find out the location of the "nest" and its fellow synthetics from Soji.

Agnes Jurati says that Dahj's entire history was fictional and was created all at once around 3 years ago. Bruce Maddox did have the ability to create an entirely new and plausible, credible identity, but then so did others. Picard decides to find and save Soji himself and begins to assemble a new crew, starting with his former Starfleet first officer Raffi Musiker (Michelle Hurd). Laris and Zahban are worried for Picard's security and warn him against the Zhat Vash. Picard narrates the events to Raffi at her house in the desert.

description: After reflecting on the past with Raffi, Picard hires her partner, Cristobal Rios, to help him in his search for Bruce Maddox; Soji's work on the Borg cube catches the attention of the executive director.
tags: ['star trek', 'cbs all access', 'year 2385', 'resigning commission', 'vasquez rocks', 'shrapnel in shoulder', 'punched in the face', 'tied to a chair', "gun held to one's own head", 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'woman wears leather', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'resignation', 'disintegration', 'electronic cigarette', 'conspiracy theory', 'daystrom institute', 'okinawa', 'cigar smoking', 'stabbed in the shoulder', 'hologram', 'hit squad', 'freecloud', 'united federation of planets', 'sequel', 'future', 'alien', 'retired captain', 'retired space captain', 'old friendship', 'jean luc picard character', 'century24', 'retired hero', 'friendship', 'friend', 'future technologies', 'old friends', 'starship crew', 'returning from retirement', '24th century', 'captain return from retirement']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mars stratosphere ignited after the attack by synthetics. Picard argued at Starfleet that the evacuation of Romulan citizens could continue by using reserve duty officers and the mothballed ships. Their plan included the use of synthetic labor, but Starfleet banned all synthetic life forms all through the Federation. All active units dismantled, and all research halted. Starfleet rules that it was a fatal code error in Synthetics programming. Back then Raffi suspected the involvement of the Tal Shiar, the parent organization of the Zhat Vash. Starfleet cannot fathom that Romulans would attack a fleet built to rescue them. Starfleet is reacting and as a result billions of life forms will perish in the blast radius of the Super Nova.

When Picard resigned following the synth attack on Mars, Starfleet fired Raffi. Picard never though Starfleet would accept his resignation. Now she resents him for that, and for not helping her in the subsequent years, and refuses to join him. She also says that Picard telling his entire plan to Kirsten Clancy was a mistake. She says that she has evidence that a high-ranking Starfleet officer allowed the Mars attack to go forward. Romulans and Starfleet conspired to end the rescue mission. However, she does find him a freelance pilot named Rios (Santiago Cabrera). Picard sends Raffi everything Daystrom had on Bruce Maddox. He wants her to study the evidence and figure out patterns and links.

Picard meets Rios on his ship. Rios is Starfleet to the core, but has a hint of resentment towards the same organization.

On the Artifact, the reclamation project's director, the former Borg drone Hugh (Jonathan Del Arco), allows Soji to interview a Romulan named Ramdha (Rebecca Wisocky) that has been reclaimed from the Borg. Ramdha says that she remembers Soji from "Tomorrow". Ramdha was crew of the very last ship ever assimilated by the captured Borg cube. Soji wants to know what happened which caused the sub-matrix collapse and the severed link to the collective. Ramdha wants to know which sister is Soji, the one who died, or the one who lived. Ramdha declares Soji to be "the destroyer" and tries to kill herself, but Soji unknowingly uses her enhanced speed to stop this from happening. Narissa gets to the Borg ship physically & warns Narek not to get emotionally attached to Soji.

The information on Ramdha's capture by the Borg was classified and it is not clear to Hugh or Narek, how Soji had knowledge of it when she met Ramdha. Narek tells Narissa that Soji has no idea who she is.

Oh approaches Dr. Jurati, who reveals her discussion with Picard. Shortly after this, Picard is attacked by Zhat Vash operatives. Jurati helps kill all of them but one, who also calls Soji "the destroyer" before committing suicide. Picard believes that Oh is a Vulcan, he is not aware of her Romulan ancestry.

Picard agrees to take Jurati on his mission to find Soji, and the pair transport aboard Rios's ship La Sirena. There they are also joined by Raffi, who believes that Soji's creator Bruce Maddox is on the planet Freecloud and will travel with them that far.

Soji calls her mother to know if Dahj is OK. Mother tells that Dahj is fine.

description: On the way to Freecloud, Picard requests a stop at a Romulan refugee planet where he reunites with Elnor, the young Romulan he befriended fourteen years ago; Narek continues to learn more about Soji.
tags: ['star trek', 'cbs all access', 'reference to the three musketeers', 'fencing practice', 'reading aloud', 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'woman wears leather', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'romulan relocation hub', 'hand gesture', 'reference to alexander dumas', 'space travel', 'hospitality hologram', 'planet vashti', 'qowat milat', 'decapitation', 'space battle', 'sequel', 'united federation of planets', 'future', 'friend', 'future technologies', 'century24', 'retired space captain', 'jean luc picard character', 'captain return from retirement', 'retired hero', 'friendship', 'alien', '24th century', 'starship crew', 'old friendship', 'old friends', 'returning from retirement', 'retired captain']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Picard asks Rios to make a detour to the planet Vashti, where he helped relocate Romulan refugees before the attack on Mars. Picard had befriended a young boy named Elnor (Evan Evagora) and promised to return for him, but abandoned the boy after he resigned from Starfleet. Elnor was then raised by the Qowat Milat, warrior nuns who have sworn an oath of absolute candor. This mean total communication of emotions, without any filter between thought and word.

Raffi is not in favor of going to Vashti, and neither is Rios. Rios says that there is a power vacuum in the entire Qiris sector. Smugglers & warlords run the show, led by Kar Kantar. Kar Kantar even has a Romulan Bird of Prey at his command. Vashti is also the hotbed of the Romulan rebirth movement. Picard says that Elnor is a trained assassin, and they need him on their team. But they are not for hire, the Qowat Milat have to chose you. The Qowat Milat are the most feared enemies of the Tal Shiar.

Now 14 years later, Picard has returned to Vashti to meet Elnor. This was his only chance to meet Elnor as he may never pass this way again in his life. Vashti has a planetary defense shield around it. Romulans refuse entry to Picard and his ship and they have to bribe their way through. As soon as Picard beams down, he is identified by the local Romulans.

Picard asks Elnor to join his quest; He explains to the Qowat Milat, & their leader Zani, that the quest he faces is dangerous and Elnor might even die. But the Qowat Milat is a woman's organization and Elnor was trained here as there was no other option for him when the evacuation was abandoned. Elnor needs a new home. Elnor initially refuses, but changes his mind when Picard is attacked by Romulans who resent Starfleet for abandoning the evacuation effort.

Picard and Elnor beam up to La Sirena, where Rios and Raffi are fighting with a local warlord Kar Kantar. A mystery ship helps La Sirena win the battle but is damaged in the process. They beam the pilot, former Borg drone Seven of Nine (Jeri Ryan), to La Sirena. Picard tells Elnor not to pick up unnecessary fights and only fight when the cause is just.

On the Artifact, Soji tries to learn more about the Romulans that were assimilated by the Artifact and their prophesied "destroyer". Legend says that Ganmadan is the Day of Annihilation. On the day all demons rise up and answer the call of the Destroyer. Soji suspects that Narek is the Tal Shiar. Soji wants to know what happened to Ramdha's ship after it was assimilated by the Borg. Narek offers to get her information on the Romulans by hacking into the Borg databases, but the pair have a falling out when he expresses doubt about Soji's past. Narek says that Terran passenger manifests are part of public record. But there is no record of Soji being on a particular ship Ellison that she claimed to be on, when she shipped out of the Beat Quadrant in 2396.

Narissa gives Narek one week to get information on other synths from Soji. Narek says that if he presses Soji too hard, it might activate her. Narissa reminds Narek that Soji is the Destroyer.

description: The La Sirena crew reach Freecloud and find Bruce Maddox in a precarious situation, so Seven of Nine, the ex-Borg they recently picked up, lends her assistance.
tags: ['star trek', 'cbs all access', 'seven of nine character', 'begins with a flashback', 'removing an eye', 'poisoned drink', 'bourbon', 'hologram', 'eye patch', 'woman wears gloves', 'woman wears overalls', 'lab', 'crossover', 'planet vergessen', 'eye removed', 'surgery without anesthetic', 'mercy killing', 'playing keyboard', 'straight bourbon', 'ranger', 'advertising', 'free cloud', 'flamboyant clothing', 'cigar smoking', 'blown to bits', 'revenge', 'dead woman', 'shooting a woman', 'woman wears a body suit', 'sequel', 'friendship', 'friend', 'united federation of planets', 'century24', 'retired hero', 'retired captain', 'retired space captain', 'old friends', 'alien', 'future', 'jean luc picard character', 'old friendship', '24th century', 'returning from retirement', 'captain return from retirement', 'starship crew', 'future technologies']
synopsis_with_character_names:
13 Years ago on the planet Vergessen of the Hypatia system, Seven of Nine was forced to euthanize her close friend Icheb (Casey King) after his Borg implants were ripped out by black market dealer Bjayzl. Icheb was in a lot of pain by the time Seven of Nine reached him, and Icheb begged her to put him out of his misery.

Seven is part of the Fenris Rangers, who still try to maintain law and order in the furthest outreaches of the galaxy. She does this without any support from Starfleet, but refuses to give up. Rios and Raffi realize that both Picard & Seven used to be Borg.

Jurati watches old videos of her and Maddox together. They used to be in a relationship.

Now, Seven travels with La Sirena to Freecloud, where Raffi learns that Bjayzl has Maddox captive and intends to sell him to the Romulans. Maddox suspected that the Tal Shiar was after him. Now Bjayzl is trying to broker a deal to sell Maddox to the Tal Shiar. It is not possible to outbid the Tal Shiar and Bjayzl is surrounded by top notch private security contractors.

Seven proposes to barter herself to Bjazyl in exchange for Maddox. She says she is doing this to maintain a semblance of order in Romulan society, ever since the Neutral zone collapsed. Rios beams down to the surface to act as a broker for the Tal Shiar. He is screened by Bjazyl's Beta Annari Mr Vup. The Beta Annari can smell if one if telling a lie. Rios then tells Vup that he is proposing a barter of his own, by offering a Romulan with many Borg implants, in exchange for Maddox. Rios suggests basically cutting the Tal Shiar out of the deal. Vup is agreeable as those many working Borg implants are worth a lot on the black market.

To free Maddox, Picard's crew stage a prisoner exchange with Seven as the bait. Picard pushes Vup that he needs to see Maddox alive, before he agrees to the exchange. Meanwhile, Raffi unsuccessfully tries to reconnect with her estranged son Gabriel before returning to La Sirena. Gabriel is married and has a daughter on the way. Gabriel says he will never forgive Raffi for abandoning him and his father, which she did to pursue the synthetics attack conspiracy on Mars. Raffi argues that the conspiracy is real and its bigger than what anybody realizes. But Gabriel cannot bring himself to forgive her. Raffi goes back to the ship.

When Bjayzl recognizes Seven (she calls her Annika), the latter drops the charade and reveals her true intention: to kill Bjayzl and avenge Icheb. Picard convinces Seven not to seek revenge and Rios tells Seven that if she kills Bjayzl she will effectively put a bounty on the entire crew. Bjayzl offers Maddox in exchange for her life. Maddox is safely beamed to La Sirena.

Later, Seven returns to Freecloud and kills Bjayzl without Picard's knowledge. In the La Sirena sickbay, Maddox tells Picard that he sent Soji and Dahj to the Artifact and Earth, respectively, in order to discover the true motivation behind the Starfleet synthetic ban. Maddox believes that the Federation are also involved on covering up the truth. The Artifact is in Romulan space.

Once left alone by Picard, Jurati confronts Maddox and discusses the fact that they used to secretly be in a relationship together. Jurati then murders Maddox and says that she wishes she didn't know what she now knows.

description: Picard and the crew trace Soji to the Borg cube, forcing Picard to face memories of being Locutus; Narek believes he's found a way to safely exploit information from Soji.
tags: ['star trek', 'cbs all access', 'drinking from a flask', 'childhood flashback', 'stabbed through the neck', 'sword', 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'woman wears leather', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'barefoot girl', 'reference to locutus of borg', 'image search', 'borg cube', 'bare chested male', 'soccer ball', 'puzzle box', 'electronic cigarette', 'persuasion', 'deception', 'borg reclamation project', 'dating an artifact', 'orchid', 'laboratory', 'locked in', 'red mist', 'breaking through a floor', 'rescue', 'holographic engineering diagram', 'teleportation', 'borg hive queen cell', 'friend', 'alien', 'future', 'united federation of planets', 'sequel', 'retired captain', 'jean luc picard character', 'returning from retirement', 'retired space captain', 'retired hero', '24th century', 'century24', 'future technologies', 'friendship', 'old friends', 'old friendship', 'starship crew']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Narek realizes that Soji has the same nightmare each night and plans to use this to find where she was created. In the dream Soji is a little girl, who enters a lab decorated with Orchids. A person is working at the console, but his face is not visible. Sojis is discovered and then she wakes up. Narek knows that Soji speaks to her mother every night. Narissa says that Soji's dreams are a malfunction, a bug. But Narek is convinced that they have been programmed in deliberately. Narek says that Soji's dreams can be a vulnerability in her system. Maybe her dreams can allow Narek to access her internal sub-systems and memories without triggering her self-defense capabilities. Narek can access the location of her home world.

Soji says that she often falls asleep while talking to her mother. Narek tells Soji each call to her mother lasts for 70 seconds exactly. Each call, every day. Doubts start creeping up in Soji's mind. Soji calls her mother, who says her father is working in the lab.

Struggling with the guilt of murdering Maddox, Jurati has sex with Rios. Picard is not looking forward to visiting a Borg cube again. Picard says that the Borg never change, they only adapt to their situation. The ship approaches Romulan territory.

To board the Artifact without causing a diplomatic incident with the Romulans, Picard asks Raffi to procure official clearance from the Federation. The Artifact is under the Borg Reclamation Project, in treaty with the Federation, so if Picard can get Federation diplomatic credentials, the Romulans would be forced to let him meet the director of the Project, Hugh. Raffi, drunk and high following her son's rejection, convinces an old Starfleet acquaintance to provide the clearance. This allows Picard to beam aboard the Artifact. Picard tells Elnor specifically not to beam aboard the Borg ship.

As Picard beams aboard, the dormant Borg sense his presence and get activated. But this time, the Borg only help to save Picard from falling inside the Borg ship. Picard meets Hugh, who gives him a tour of the ship. Hugh tells Picard that the former Borgs are called XBs. Picard says that he wants to meet Soji. Hugh knows Soji and also knows that Narek is a Romulan spy. Hugh knows Soji is in danger. Picard sees that Romulans have perfected the science of undoing a Borg assimilation. Hugh says that now the Borg Queen is a Romulan.

Meanwhile Raffi realizes that the Tal Shiar has kept Soji alive for a reason.

Due to Narek's manipulation, Soji begins to discover that her identity was recently manufactured. Soji scans all her stuff and realizes that all of her physical belongings were created 37 months ago. This includes her childhood stuffed toys, her school drawings, her photos, everything

Narek guides her through the Romulan meditation practice of Zhal Makh to explore her dreams: she is able to identify clues hinting at the place she was created (she sees 2 moon, dark as blood and with lots of lightening). Narek also tells Soji that his true name is Hrai Yan. Soi continues her dreams beyond the point where she wakes up. She still cannot see her father's face, but she can see that her father is working on a model of Soji. Soji is a doll and in pieces. Narek tells Soji that she is not real and attempts to poison her with radiation. This activates her self-defense mechanism which allows her to escape by digging a hole through the floor of the chamber where Narek had imprisoned her.

While escaping, Soji runs into Picard, and Hugh helps them transport to the nearby planet Nepenthe. Before beaming off, Picard gives his destination to Rios and Raffi.

Raffi can see that Picard is in serious trouble on board the Artifact. Elnor beams aboard the Artifact to help Hugh cover their tracks and from preventing the Tal Shiar from tracking their location.

description: Picard and Soji, who's struggling to make sense of her recently unlocked memories, travel to a planet that happens to be the home of Picard's old friends Will Riker and Deanna Troi; Elnor and Hugh are left on the Borg cube to face Narissa.
tags: ['cbs all access', 'star trek', 'husband wife relationship', 'deanna troi character', 'william t. riker character', 'vulcan mind meld', 'begins with a flashback', 'tracking device', 'bow and arrow', 'reference to isaac asimov', 'reference to sherlock holmes', 'outdoor shower', 'pizza', 'tomato', 'foaming at the mouth', 'coma', 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'woman wears leather', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'antarean basil', 'mass murder', 'cigar smoking', 'planet nepenthe', 'reference to data', 'woman in a shower', 'throwing knife', 'stabbed in the neck', 'uranium hydride', 'self injection', 'woman in a coma', 'woman wrapped in a towel', 'jean luc picard character', 'future', 'sequel', 'retired hero', 'friend', 'retired space captain', 'old friendship', 'retired captain', 'returning from retirement', 'old friends', 'united federation of planets', 'alien', 'starship crew', 'century24', 'future technologies', 'friendship']
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Jurati was approached by Oh, the latter used a Vulcan mind meld to reveal the horrifying potential consequences of allowing synthetic life like Soji to exist. Oh shows Jurati that Synthetics will eventually lead to a total destruction of the planet Earth, along with many other planets and extinction of several life forms. Jurati agrees to help destroy Soji and ingested a tracking device.

The La Sirena is locked in a Borg tractor beam from the Artifact and is unable to warp out. Jurati says that the Romulans don't want them, they are after Soji and Picard. Jurati tells Raffi to just ask the Romulans to let them go and tell them that they want to return to their home world.

Narek now uses Jurati's injected tracking device to track La Sirena. Narissa releases Rios's ship when Narek is ready to track them in his own. Rios knows that a ship is tracking them, but no matter what he does, he cannot shake the pursuing ship. Rios believes that Raffi is being tracked and shares his concerns with Jurati. A guilt-ridden Jurati takes an injection that places her in a coma and stops the tracking.

Narrisa wanted to know where Hugh had beamed Picard and Soji, but Hugh won't betray them. Narissa kills all of Hugh's reclaimed XBs. Elnor finds Hugh and together they go back to the Queencell on the Artifact. Hugh wants to take the Artifact back from the Romulans and use it to protect the XBs. Elnor's attempts to protect Hugh on the Artifact are unsuccessful when Narissa fatally wounds Hugh. Hugh tells Elnor that to activate the Queencell, he will need an XB. Before dying, Hugh gives Elnor a device to signal Seven of Nine's vigilante group, the Fenris Rangers.

On Nepenthe, Picard reunites with his old friends and colleagues William Riker (Jonathan Frakes) and Deanna Troi (Marina Sirtis), whose son Thad died after the medical procedure he required was banned as part of the synthetic ban. Thad had a silicon-based virus, and it was completely curable. The active cells had to be cultured in a Positronic matrix to develop an anti-virus. But by the time Thad was infected, there were no Positronic matrices left. No one was allowed to develop new ones.

Riker, Troi, and their daughter Kestra give shelter to Picard and Soji until La Sirena arrives. Picard tells Kestra that Soji is Data's daughter and Kestra casually remarks that then Soji is an android, which comes as a complete shock to Soji. Picard tells Soji that Dahj is dead and was murdered. Soji doubts how Data could be her father if she was created only 3 years ago.

Troi and Riker can see Soji's pain following Narek's betrayal, and help Picard begin to earn her trust. Riker tells Picard that he is dealing with a teenager, and he will have to work very differently to get her to trust him. Soji tells Troi that they way Troi is being all sensitive and caring towards her, makes her trust Troi even less. Soji definitely does not trust Picard. Picard tells Soji that she was created from a remnant of Data, who was a dear friend to them all. Plus, having Soji in his life means that his life again has a mission and a purpose. Soji can monitor all of Picard's vital life signs and believes that he is telling the truth.

The family also try to help Soji come to terms with being an android and are able to help identify the location from her dream. Soji tells the group about her vision of the 2 blood red moons and the lightening. Riker speculates that Maddox found this planet and resumed his work to create synthetic life forms. There might be many more there. The Romulans already have a head start. Kestra says that the planet is in the Gulion system in the Vayt sector. The planet doesn't have a name, only a number.

Rios reaches Nepenthe and picks up Picard and Soji.

description: Picard realizes how far some will go to protect secrets that go back generations when truths about the attack on Mars are revealed; Narissa orders her guards to capture Elnor, setting off a chain reaction on the Borg cube.

synopsis_with_character_names:
Oh recounts Romulan history. During their exploration, they came upon an uncharted system with eight stars. They found a storehouse of preserved memories. They saw the grim fate of the civilization that perished on the planet long ago. The Romulans called it the Admonition. The fore mothers found the Admonition. They formed the Zhat Vash of which Ramdha, Oh & Narissa were a part. The Admonition warned off annihilation from the skies.

For hundreds of years, the Zhat Vash worked to prevent a second coming of the Destroyers. As part of their joining ritual, every Zhat Vash must endure the Admonition, and many of them commit suicide after that. Only a few can endure and remain sane. Only Narissa and Oh could endure. Ramdha goes insane but is saved by Narissa. Oh asks Narissa to start her work to stop the synthetics from Mars. When the Borg assimilated the Tal Shair ship with Ramdha on it, she broke it the entire ship with the sheer force of her despair.

Narissa has already dispatched a fleet to the synthetics home world.

Picard and Soji beam aboard La Sirena, and Rios has a panic attack when he sees Soji. Picard asks Rios to take the ship to the nearest star base Deep Space 12. Picard tells Soji that they cannot face the Romulans without help from Starfleet. Raffi finds out that Jurati had a tracking isotope in her blood, and she believes Jurati killed Maddox. Raffi doesn't trust Soji either.

When Jurati wakes up she offers to turn herself over to Starfleet. Jurati says that she saw hell in the mind meld with Oh and now he thinks of committing suicide every day. The hell in Oh's mind meld was thousands of centuries old, but now humans are at the same threshold. Unless the synthetics are destroyed, the current Galaxy and all of the current life forms are headed for the same hell. The hell will come with the appearance of the Destroyer, Soji. After meeting Soji she chooses not to harm her.

Picard presents his report to Kirsten Clancy, who agrees to Picard's findings and sends a Starfleet squadron to meet him at Deep Space 12. Clancy agrees that the synthetics need to be protected from the Romulans. Raffi tells Rios that on the Cube she saw Romulans drawing a picture with eight circles, over and over. Rios speculates that this could be a system with 8 stars, while Raffi thought this referred to the council of eight, who planned the attack on Mars. Raffi now realizes that the drawing refers to place where the council met.

Rios tells Raffi about his Starfleet captain on the ship Ibn Majid, who murdered two people on Starfleet's orders before committing suicide. The Starfleet had promised destruction of the Ibn Majid and all its crew, if their orders were not carried out. One of them was named Jana. Rios beamed the bodies out of the ship and deleted the logs. 6 months later he was discharged from Starfleet. Jana was a splitting image of Soji. Oh gave the order to kill Jana.

The chances of a Octonary star system (with 8 stars) occurring naturally are close to zero, so it would have to be built. One would have to capture eight stars and move them light years and set them into motion. It would only be done if you had something important to say, and you wanted to make sure that people paid attention.

Raffi also pieces together that the Romulans discovered a warning from a past civilization (who lived 200,000 to 300,000 years ago) about the horrors of evolved synthetic life. The civilization dragged 8 stars into a system and placed a planet in the middle of it. On the planet they placed the warning, the Admonition. When the synthetics cross an evolution threshold, somebody really bad shows up. Romulans took the Admonition seriously and created the Zhat Vash to terminate all synthetic life. 30-40 years ago Dr Noonien Soong created Data. The Zhat Vash sent the half-Romulan Oh to infiltrate Starfleet and instigate the Mars attack as part of their anti-synthetic plan. Romulans engineered the attack the Mars to place a ban on all synthetics.

9 years ago, the people Rios's captain murdered were synthetics from Soji's home world, and one of them, Jana, looked just like her. This is the world where Bruce Maddox created an entire society of synthetics, hidden from Federation eyes. The Zhat Vash have been searching for this world ever since.

Hearing this activates memories for Soji and she plots a course for her home, still followed by Narek. Soji has knowledge of the Borg's Transwarp conduit networks. A short cut through space.

On the Artifact, Seven of Nine arrives to help Elnor fight the Romulans. She connects with the Cube and reactivates the Queencell. She also activates the Borg drones that are in stasis on the Artifact, but the Romulans kill all of the drones by releasing them into space. The Romulans then abandon the Artifact and prepare to invade the synthetic home world. Narissa is captured by the XBs before she can escape the Artifact.

description: With the Romulans in pursuit, Picard and the crew finally reach Soji's home planet - and discover more than they expected about the inhabitants.
tags: ['part one', 'cloaking device', 'co written by director', 'vulcan mind meld', 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'woman wears leather', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'planet coppelius', 'borg cube', 'space ship crash', 'reference to surak', 'butterfly', 'abomination', 'ginger tabby cat', 'sequel', 'star trek', 'alien', 'jean luc picard character', 'friend', '24th century', 'century24', 'united federation of planets', 'retired hero', 'future technologies', 'captain return from retirement', 'retired captain', 'future', 'old friends', 'friendship', 'starship crew', 'old friendship', 'retired space captain', 'returning from retirement']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Using a Borg trans-warp conduit, La Sirena arrives at Soji's home-world, Coppelius, several days before the Romulan fleet. La Sirena never went to Deep Space 12 as planned. They traveled 25 light years in 15 minutes. Narek arrives and attacks but is interrupted when the Artifact follows them through the Transwarp conduit as well. A planetary defense system in the form of giant orchids engulf the spaceships and drags the three ships to the planet's surface. Picard requires medical attention following the crash.

Jurati discovers his terminal illness while scanning Picard with a Tricorder, and Picard reveals it to the rest of the crew. Before crashing the La Sirena found a settlement about 5-6 kilometers away from their present location. Soji says that it is Coppelius station and that she was born there.

After finding Elnor and Seven alive in the wreckage of the Artifact, the crew travels to the settlement where Dahj and Soji were created. They also activate the Artifact and its long-range scanners to find a fleet of 218 Romulan war-birds coming towards Coppelius. Elnor and Seven stay back on the Artifact to bring its defensive systems back online for the oncoming battle with the Romulans.

They find Maddox's science partner (and the son of Data's creator Noonien Soong) Altan Inigo Soong (Brent Spiner) with a colony of synthetics, including Jana's twin Sutra (Isa Briones). The planet only had 15 orchids to defend them, but now only has 10 left. Not nearly enough to repel the Romulan attack. Romulans will arrives in 2 days' time.

Sutra always had a passion for Vulcan culture. Sutra uses a mind meld to see the vision Oh showed Jurati and believes that it is a message to synthetic life from higher beings. Sutra believes that the Romulans may have been driving themselves insane for centuries, over something that wasn't meant for consumption by the Organic mind at all.

The message says that Organics yearn for perfection which results in the creation of Synthetic life. But then the Organic perceive the Synthetics as a threat since the Synthetics do not age or die. Organics will seek to destroy the Synthetics and in so doing, destroy themselves. The higher beings are an alliance of Synthetic life, waiting for a signal. The higher beings, when summoned, will offer their protection to the Synthetics. The Synthetics evolution will be the extinction of the Organics. The Romulan suspicions are confirmed.

Altan shows Jurati that he made a Golem body but hasn't figured out how to transfer someone's consciousness into it. Maddox was the substrates man.

Sutra tells Soji that there is no point in running from the Romulans. Soji says that the battle will cost many lives and there has to be an alternative. Picard calls Starfleet and reports first contact with the Synthetics on Ghulion IV. He asks for protection from an incoming Romulan attack.

Narek is held prisoner by the Synthetics. Narek again tries to manipulate Soji by saying that he loves her. But this time Soji takes no pity on him. But later, Sutra stops by and helps Narek escape with a mission of her own. Narek heads to the Artifact.

Soong, Soji, and the other synthetics support Sutra's plan to call these higher beings before the Romulans arrive. The Admonition had the subspace frequencies required to contact them. Soong and Sutra have created a beacon for sending the signal. Soong and Sutra argue that Organics will also treat Synthetics as a threat. Peace is not possible. The higher beings will eliminate all organic life forms and eliminate the threat of extermination for the Synthetics. Picard disagrees and is taken prisoner. Picard says that Soji became the Destroyer after all. Jurati promises to support the Synthetics.

description: Picard and his team are pitted against the Romulans and the synthetics of Coppelius in a final confrontation.
tags: ['season finale', 'part two', 'co written by director', 'grenade', 'reference to judgement day', 'reference to ragnarok', 'illusion', 'red alert', 'beacon', 'death', 'evil woman', 'arrogant woman', 'female fighter', 'villainess', 'villainess as protagonist', 'female fight', 'woman fights a woman', 'leather', 'leather pants', 'turtleneck sweater', 'deceased', 'butterfly', 'failure of the imagination', 'fear', 'falling to death', 'space battle', 'destroyer', 'year 2379', 'jean luc picard character', 'sequel', 'friendship', 'retired captain', 'retired hero', 'starship crew', 'alien', 'future', 'united federation of planets', '24th century', 'friend', 'captain return from retirement', 'returning from retirement', 'star trek', 'future technologies', 'old friendship', 'retired space captain', 'century24', 'old friends', 'death of friend']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Narek reaches the Artifact and is found by Narissa. Narek had been instructed to destroy the planetary defense orchids, so that the Romulans can attack without any obstruction, and this would give a clear reason to the Synthetics to activate the beacon.

Rios and Raffi are on the La Sirena. They are trying to fix the ship with a mysterious tool given to them by the Synthetics. The tool works on imagination. One imagines the fix needed and the tool makes it happen. The ship powers up. Narek reaches the La Sirena and is followed by Elnor who tracked him from the Artifact. He convinces Raffi, Rios, and Elnor to help him destroy the synthetics' beacon. He says the Synthetic higher beings will destroy all organic life in the known Galaxy.

Narek narrates the story of Romulan history of Ganmadan. The story began in the distant past, with some Romulans believing it occurred before their ancestors arrived at Vulcan, with a pair of Khalagu, the twin sisters Seb-Cheneb (The Destroyer) and Seb-Natan (The Foreteller). After the death of Seb-Natan from a burst heart while playing her drum, Seb-Cheneb blew the horn of a pale Ganmadan, summoning the Ch'Khalagus (demons) who brought about the Thousand Days of Pain. Narek, believed the story was not a prophecy. He believed it was history and that it could happen again.

Jurati works with Soong to complete Maddox's work on downloading a person's consciousness into a Golem body The Romulan fleet is led by Commodore Oh. Rios, Raffi, and Elnor pretend to hold Narek prisoner as they walk into the Synthetics settlement where the transmitter is being built. Their plan is to destroy the transmitter with molecular grenades.

Jurati frees Picard and the pair escape to La Sirena, which Picard flies to confront and stall the Romulans. Oh orders the fleet to sterilize the entire planet, but the Orchids rise to engage the Romulan fleet and to distract them for a few minutes. Narissa targets La Sirena with the Artifacts' defenses but is stopped and killed by Seven of Nine.

Soong discovers that Sutra worked with Narek to convince the other synthetics to agree with her plan, and he incapacitates her. But there isn't enough time for Soong to explain his reasons to Soji. Soji believes that Soong is a human and hence trying to protect his kind. Soji foils the attempt to destroy the beacon and activates it.

Picard calls Soji to reconsider her decision. Picard tells Soji that he will sacrifice his own life to change her mind. Meanwhile Jurati uses the Synthetics tool on board the La Sirena to fashion an image multiplier that gives the impression that the planet is defended by an entire fleet and not a single ship. Picard begins to succumb to his illness, but Jurati prolongs his life long enough for him to distract the Romulans until a Starfleet armada arrives in support, led by Riker.

Picard again speaks to Soji and asks her to prove everyone wrong. She is not the Destroyer. Picard says that the Federation trusts her to make the right choice. This gives Soji the choice to turn the beacon off herself, which she does, and the Romulans retreat.

Picard dies after Jurati and Soong transfer his consciousness into a device holding Maddox's copy of Data's consciousness. There, Picard once again "meets" Data and Picard realizes that Data sacrificed his life to save Picard and was happy to do so. Data asks Picard to erase his consciousness when he awakens in the real world. Data says that mortality gives meaning to human life and that however briefly, he wanted to live like a mortal. Picard says goodbye to Data before awaking in a synthetic "Golem" body. Picard keeps his promise to Data and deactivates Maddox's copy of Data's consciousness.

After the Federation lifts the ban on synthetics, Picard and Soji set off in La Sirena with Rios, Raffi, Jurati, Elnor, and Seven of Nine.

description: Archie's old buddy, Eddie Frazier, has amassed a fortune in the used car trade. However, Eddie's quest for money comes at a huge price: his estranged family wants nothing to do with him.
tags: ['millionaire', 'eavesdropping on a telephone call', 'generation gap', 'car dealer', 'father son estrangement', 'reference to ralph nader', 'reference to johnny carson', 'reference to bob hope', 'war buddy', 'old friend', 'world war two veteran', 'licking an envelope', 'reference to the vietnam war', 'cigar', 'malapropism', 'unexpected gift', 'car', 'black sheep', 'racial slur']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Archie is having a argument/conversation with Mike about dropouts. Archie: They got the greatest county in the World, with the highest standard of living and the grossest national product." Mike: Archie, look at the United States as a House on Fire, Now those kids see the fire but they don't have the equipment to put it out, does that mean they shouldn't yell: Help, Fire, Help, Fire." Archie;" I think your dead from the neck up."

A package arrives, and Archie opens it, it's a box of expensive Cigars, while Archie is happily examining the Cigars another Package arrives, its an expensive gift package, that includes Caviar and expensive Cheeses, It's from the richest person Archie Knows, an old Army buddy, worth Five Million dollars. The Fabulous Eddie Frasier. Archie is impressed by what Eddie has made of himself, he is kind of like Archie's Idol, if not Hero. the phone rings and its Eddie Frasier himself, Archie is delighted to hear from him, Eddie wants to set up a Army reunion at the Bunker household for the next night. Billy Pendergast, The Fugue Twins, and the unspeakable Eddie frasier. The next night Eddie is the last to arrive but he is soon the life of the party showing the kind of personality and dash that made him the most successful Used Car dealer west of the Mississsippi. Mike for one is not impressed, the man may be Rich but he doesn't seem interested in anything but Material possessions and really has nothing to say, and seems a bit phony as if he is trying too hard to prove that he is happy and on top of the World, plus he seems to be drinking some form of Alcohol at every turn, while the rest just seem to be nursing their drinks, still Archie is Star-struck. While the Party is going on Eddie receives a phone call, that Mike happens to overhear, Eddie is begging his Son to see him, even offering him 500 dollars to meet for five minutes, he is practically crying, Billy notices this and points it out to Archie, who scoffs at this, " Crying, he is crying all the way to the bank with 60 million bucks." it's interesting that every time Archie mentions Eddies worth , the number keeps escalating, it started with five million and now its 60 million. when he hangs up, he looks at Mike he must be the same age as his estranged Son. Eddie: " That boy can have anything he wants." Mike: " Whats does he want from you. Eddie; dropping his facade, " He wants me to stay the hell away from him." Eddie at this point looks totally distraught and out of answers, he seems to be questioning his own success. Archie and his army buddies, begin singing 'For he's a jolly good fella." when they get to the part in the song, where they say 'that nobody can deny' Mike looks on sadly.

description: Travelers from our future return to our time to try to correct the terrible problems that face humanity in their own time.
tags: ['domestic violence', 'abusive husband', 'domestic abuse', 'intellectual disability', 'intellectually disabled woman', 'woman with a mental disability', 'mental disability', 'person with a mental disability', 'intellectually disabled person', 'drug addict', 'conceding a fight', 'cage fight', 'woman fending off attacker', 'man attacks a woman', 'social worker', 'opening the door naked', 'power outage', 'death from heart attack', 'skateboarding', 'lottery winner', 'fbi agent', 'seizure', 'library', 'backlit in sheer dress', 'facial cut', 'answering the door nude', 'concussion', 'broken hand', 'crying baby', 'self injection', 'overdose', 'close up of eye', 'bare chested male', 'outnumbered 4 to 1']
synopsis_with_character_names:
In this first episode, one by one, 5 individuals who were meant to die, are suddenly okay. We see the countdown to their recorded time of death, then they writhe in pain, and resume their lives.

The first is Marcy, a woman with a head trauma, causing a speech impediment and severe loss of mental functioning. She works as a cleaning lady at the library, and uses her spare time to learn how to read children's picture books. Helplessly making noises to stop an attack on another woman, she herself is attacked by 4 men. We see the countdown to her death, then she is okay. She easily defends herself against the 4 men, who run off, defeated. Notably, her speech impediment is gone.

The second is Trevor, a high school student fighting in a mixed martial arts match. After the countdown to his death, Trevor quickly concedes the fight, and we are later told that, if he had not, he would certainly have died that night.

The third individual is Phillip, a drug addict. His friend lies dead nearby, but he bypasses his own death and leaves.

Next, Carly is brutality knocked to the ground by her husband, with their infant child nearby. While she should have died, she gets up and orders her husband to leave.

Most of the show introduces us to the lives of the 5 characters. At various points, we see each of the first 4 characters accessing Internet messages about "travelers," specifically about the pending arrival of a traveler. Carly cryptically refers to this traveler as "daddy" when speaking to her baby. Tipped off by his partner, FBI Agent MacLaren reads and follows up on the messages, which we are told were on the Deep Web.

Trevor is on schedule to earn a football scholarship, which he carelessly put at risk through his fight. His father shows serious disappointment in his actions (which apparently he thinks was a street fight), while his mother tries to show understanding. He asks his loving girlfriend and his best friend to be understanding, as his concussion has resulted in temporary memory loss.

Carly continues to care for her baby, while enforcing strict rules with her husband, Jeff, who turns out to be a police officer. At one point, she has to defend herself through serious physical action, quickly subduing Jeff.

Phillip is interrogated by a police officer who has been tracking his criminal behavior. The officer questions him about his friend's death and his lack of action.

After being released, Phillip makes $92,000 by playing the lottery through his attorney, while providing his lawyer with winning tips as incentive. When his attorney asks how he can win like this, he says he's from the future. His attorney assumes that this apparent lie means that he doesn't want to reveal his secret. When the police officer asks him what he's going to use the money for (since he claims it's not for drugs), Phillip replies (truthfully) that it's to finance a secret hideout. The officer likewise assumes he's just joking.

When the arresting officer later chases after Phillip, he suffers a heart attack, but Phillip must turn down his request to call 911, although he is clearly remorseful. He indicates that he can't change history, and gives us a clue as to what is going on. He mentions that the officer was considered as a host, since it was known that he was going to die. At this time we realize why he also didn't call 911 when his friend died.

When Marcy's social worker, David, comes to her apartment, Marcy acts odd, but it takes a while for him to realize that she now speaks normally and can read fluently. Marcy (or rather, the woman who is using Marcy as a host) is unaware of this transformation, and can't offer an explanation, even when David consults another professional about her apparent miraculous transformation. His contact only offers one explanation: Marcy has been playing him and defrauding the system. Marcy has to escape from a forced hospitalization, and shows up at David's apartment to use his computer. David tries to be understanding, but all Marcy tells him is that she's working on something "important."

FBI Agent MacLaren spends most of the first episode tracking down the messages about "travelers." He knows that they will be meeting in an abandoned building that night. One by one he tracks them down, speaking to Trevor's parents, Phillip's arresting officer, Carly, and Marcy's social worker. The whole process seems all too easy, and we can conclude by the end of the episode that they actually fed him the information, so that he could go to the building.

That night, when he arrives alone at the abandoned building to stop their activity, we discover that he would have fallen down the elevator shaft that night, during the sudden blackout. The others explain that they are from an apocalyptic future, and thousands have come back to save the future. They occupy bodies from the present that would have died anyway. They even explain that MacLaren would soon die. However, they stop MacLaren from falling, and his body is then occupied by what turns out to be the leader of the 5.
